summary: The study validated a phage display assay using WW domain variants and showed that the selection rounds increased the frequency of specific mutations.
key_claims: Quantitative Sanger sequencing data demonstrated an increase in mutation frequencies for selected WW domain variants compared to wild type over multiple rounds of selection.
Control experiments confirmed the reliability of the selection process.
_title: High-resolution mapping of protein sequence-function relationships
_abstract: Round 6/Input (all) vs. Round 3/Input (all) Round 6/Input (m1) vs. Round 3/Input (m1) Round 6/Input (all) vs. Round 6/Input (m1) Round 6/Input (all) vs. Round 6/Input (m2)
